results.title: Camera magic: the art of special effects
results.creator_credit: Jerry Samuelson, Paul Burnford and Pyramid Films
results.brief_description: Demonstrates a variety of camera techniques which can be used to produce special effects with an ordinary 16mm or 8mm motion picture camera without employing special equipment. Shows rotation in space, multiple images, upside down and reverse action, instant appearance and disappearance of objects and people and fast and slow motion. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Jerry Samuelson, Paul Burnford and Pyramid Films

results.title: Camera Case
results.brief_description: A high-end video camera from Blackmagic Design might seem a world apart from the old-fashioned TV antennas used to provide picture reception, but our desire to view the world has remained much the same.
results.description: “It’s a more lateral perspective that I am taking with the moving image” said Edie Kurzer, award-winning costume designer. As the artist behind this display, she knows that our view of the world can change dramatically depending on the lens we are using. This cabinet includes a toy camera that takes real photos and a Kodascope movie projector used to play 8mm films. A high-end video camera from Blackmagic Design might seem a world apart from the old-fashioned TV antennas used to provide picture reception, but our desire to view the world has remained much the same.
description_for_label: “It’s a more lateral perspective that I am taking with the moving image” said Edie Kurzer, award-winning costume designer. As the artist behind this display, she knows that our view of the world can change dramatically depending on the lens we are using. This cabinet includes a toy camera that takes real photos and a Kodascope movie projector used to play 8mm films. A high-end video camera from Blackmagic Design might seem a world apart from the old-fashioned TV antennas used to provide picture reception, but our desire to view the world has remained much the same.

results.title: Camera
results.creator_credit: Mike Crisp, Harris Watts and BBC
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “On camera: the BBC video production course”.
Consist of four parts: 1. The “Camera and the eye”. Shows the difficulties faced by the camera lens as compared by the eye and notes the advantages of the camera. 2. “Lenses and apertures”. Explains focal length, angle of view, depth of field, aperture openings, the times 2 extender and the gain switch. 3. “Short sizes and camera moves”. Explains basic terminology - such as pan, tilt, depress, track and zoom. 4. “Crossing the line” Shows how to mantain continuity of direction to avoid confusing the viewer.

results.title: Camera
results.creator_credit: Bruce A. Block, Tim Barr and Charles Cahill and Associates
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Film making techniques”.
Uses interviews with cinematographers including Lazlo Kovacs, Lee Garmes and James Crabe to explain the major points of motion picture photography and cameras. Defines and explains many techniques including dolly shots, lenses, camera movement, film speeds and camera focus.

results.title: Camels and the Pitjantjara
results.creator_credit: Roger Sandall, Curtis Levy and Australian Institute of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Studies
results.brief_description: Shows the daily life of nomadic Central Australian Aborigines of the Pitjantjara tribe who have acquired camels, guns and other modern equipment. Shows the capture of a wild camel and travels in the MacDonnell Range hunting rabbits and living off the land.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Roger Sandall, Curtis Levy and Australian Institute of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Studies

results.title: Camelot
results.creator_credit: Joshua Logan, Jack L. Warner and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Adapted from the very successful Broadway show, “Camelot” features songs from the renowned songwriting team of Lerner and Loewe. Starring Richard Harris, Vanessa Redgrave, Franco Nero, David Hemmings and Lionel Jeffries, it tells of the tragic romantic triangle between Arthur, Guinevere and Sir Lancelot.

results.title: Camel
results.creator_credit: John Shaw, Don Murray and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Wildlife Australia”.
A study of the history of the camel in Australia and the way the animal has adapted to the environment. Corrects some of the popular misconceptions about the camel and its habitat and shows people who work with them in the outback. Two other introduced species - horses and donkeys - are also mentioned.

results.title: Came a hot friday
results.creator_credit: Ian Mune, Larry Parr, Challenge Film Corporation and Mirage Films
results.brief_description: It is 1949. The privations of war are over and there is money to be made! Two conmen have been successfully cheating bookies at racetracks across the United States. When they stop at a small town called Tainuia Junction, their luck runs out. After waging a war with the local police and the owner of the town casino, they enlist the aid of the Tainuia Kid, a Zorro nut and the wildest comic ever to ride the ranges. It is the bad guys versus the not-so-bad guys in this off-the-wall comedy that takes the viewer on a rollercoaster of laughs against a backdrop of horseracing, gambling, fast cars and loose women. Starring Billy T. James, Peter Bland, Phillip Gordon and Marshall Napier. Based on the novel by Ronald Hugh Morrieson.
